document.docAuthor: Theischinger, Günther, Billingham, Zacariah D., Martin, John & Growns, Ivor
document.masterDocTitle: The genus Rhabdomastix Skuse in Australia (Diptera: Tipuloidea: Limoniidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The genus Rhabdomastix Skuse in Australia (Diptera: Tipuloidea: Limoniidae)

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 45–47.
Rhabdomastix ( Rhabdomastix) tonnoirana Alexander
, male. 45: habitus; 46: antennae; 47: terminalia, dor- sal. Scale bar = 2 mm for 45, 0.2 mm for 47.

FIGURE 48.
Rhabdomastix ( Rhabdomastix) tonnoirana Alexander
, holotype female: leg; wing; slide + label.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Only the female of
R. ( R.) tonnoirana
has been described ( Alexander 1934 ). The first description of the male is presented below. Subsequently details not made available in the original description are given for the female.

Description (from dry pinned material and material preserved in 80% ethanol). Male ( Figs. 45–47 ). Head. Including palpus, antenna and rostrum dark greyish brown. Antenna yellowish to brownish grey; less than 1.0 mm long, pedicellus longer than flagellomere 1–5; f1 ovate, f3 about twice as long as wide; some verticils longer than flagellomeres.
Thorax. Largely dark greyish brown without much pattern discernable. Legs with coxa, trochanter and most of femur dark yellow, remainder of leg markedly darker.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 49–51.
Rhabdomastix
(
Rhabdomastix) tonnoirana
Alexander
, female. 49: habitus; 50: antennae 51: terminalia, lateral; insert: cerci, lateral. Scale bar = 2 mm for 49, 0.5 mm for 50.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Wing. Membrane largely slightly suffused with greyish white and with distinct greyish brown grey pattern. Cell dm produced along vein M
1+2
. Dark patch at origin of Rs large, squarish and extended into basal radial cell, dark patch between level cord and end of R
1
distinctly fused with patch on cord, a small dark patch about halfway between patch at origin of Rs and cord; dark patch on R
3
and R
4
subcircular, extended into cell R
3+4
; patch on R
4
not or hardly fused with darkening of wing tip. Halters with stem yellowish white and knob greyish brown.
Abdomen. Brownish and greyish yellow to dark greyish brown.

Terminalia. Gonocoxite plump, twice as long as wide. Outer and inner gonostylus shorter than width of gonocoxite; outer gonostylus with distinct obtuse to pointed subapical/apical (depending on the view) mesal beak; inner gonostylus almost straight, conical, with apex rounded. Interbases short, bowed, apex rounded or at least not point- ed. Aedeagus appearing apically bilobed, longer than rather small vesica; apodeme of vesica distinctly fan-shaped and at least as long as vesica.

Additional details of the female. ( Figs. 48–51 ). Head. The female antenna seems to be longer than that of the male and the flagellum is all pale to dark greyish brown, scape and pedicel more brownish yellow.
Thorax. Slightly paler than in male.
Wing. Dark spots larger and somewhat better defined than in male.
Terminalia. Cerci markedly longer than 0.2 mm ; hypogynial valves also short.
Distribution. South-eastern: New South Wales , Victoria, Tasmania ( Map 2 ).

Discussion.
R. ( R.) tonnoirana
shares only with
R. collessiana
and
R. rosae
a cell dm that is produced along vein M
1+2
. It differs from
R. collessiana
by lacking a dark wing patch between level origin of Rs and cord level, and from
R. rosae
by a rather uniformly dark thorax versus a vivid dark and yellow thoracic pattern.
R. tonnoirana
and
R. collessiana
were found to coexist at Wilson River Reserve, 15 km NW Bellangry, at 244 m asl, in New South Wales .
